2 factor authentication.definition: An extra layer of security used to make sure that people trying to gain access to an online account are who they say they are.

2 factor authentications.definition: An extra layer of security used to make sure that people trying to gain access to an online account are who they say they are.

51% attack.definition: An attack on blockchain consensus by controlling over 51% of the block producing power on the network.

51% attacks.definition: An attack on blockchain consensus by controlling over 51% of the block producing power on the network.

address.definition: Unique public identifier for an entity on a blockchain.

addresss.definition: Unique public identifier for an entity on a blockchain.

aggregator.definition: Tool that combines multiple sources, to offer competitive options.

aggregators.definition: Tool that combines multiple sources, to offer competitive options.

airdrop.definition: A free distribution of crypto assets to users.

airdrops.definition: A free distribution of crypto assets to users.

allowance.definition: Allows an entity, usually a smart contract, the right to use a specified amount of your tokens in a transaction.

allowances.definition: Allows an entity, usually a smart contract, the right to use a specified amount of your tokens in a transaction.

alternative layer 1.definition: Layer 1 blockchains other than Ethereum and Bitcoin.

alternative layer 1s.definition: Layer 1 blockchains other than Ethereum and Bitcoin.

amm.definition: (Automated Market Maker) A trade matchmaking system, based on a public algorithm.

amms.definition: (Automated Market Maker) A trade matchmaking system, based on a public algorithm.

aplicativo de carteira.definition: Um aplicativo em seu computador ou celular, usado para se conectar à sua carteira na blockchain.

aplicativos blockchain.definition: Aplicativos na blockchain que permitem trocar criptomoedas, usar redes sociais baseadas em web3, fazer doações para obras de caridade, ou até mesmo aprender na blockchain — como na Bankless Academy.

asynchronous.definition: Communication between multiple collaborators, where participants don’t have to be present at time of messaging.

asynchronouss.definition: Communication between multiple collaborators, where participants don’t have to be present at time of messaging.

attestation.definition: A vote made by each validator to reach a consensus on whether to approve a transaction

attestations.definition: A vote made by each validator to reach a consensus on whether to approve a transaction

auto-custodial.definition: Um método de armazenamento de seus ativos no qual apenas você tem acesso a eles.

auto-custódia.definition: Um método de armazenamento de seus ativos no qual apenas você tem acesso a eles.

autonomy.definition: The quality of governing your own actions, rather than adhering to frameworks of others.

autonomys.definition: The quality of governing your own actions, rather than adhering to frameworks of others.

banco central.definition: Uma instituição que regula o dinheiro, os bancos e a moeda em um país.

banco comercial.definition: Um banco que administra o dinheiro para pessoas e empresas.

bancos centrais.definition: Uma instituição que regula o dinheiro, os bancos e a moeda em um país.

bancos comerciais.definition: Um banco que administra o dinheiro para pessoas e empresas.

bet.definition: Risking money in exchange for greater rewards.

bets.definition: Risking money in exchange for greater rewards.

block.definition: A group of transactions on the blockchain.

block builder.definition: Highly specialized validator nodes who construct blocks from transactions submitted to the network.

block builders.definition: Highly specialized validator nodes who construct blocks from transactions submitted to the network.

block explorer.definition: Search and exploration tool for blockchain data.

block explorers.definition: Search and exploration tool for blockchain data.

block hash.definition: The unique identifier for each block file. Each new block refers to the block hash of the previous block to form the single-file connected blockchain.

block hashs.definition: The unique identifier for each block file. Each new block refers to the block hash of the previous block to form the single-file connected blockchain.

block proposer.definition: The validator node chosen by the network algorithm to select the next block to be added to the blockchain.

block proposers.definition: The validator node chosen by the network algorithm to select the next block to be added to the blockchain.

block reward.definition: An amount of native coin given to the proposer of a new valid block.

block rewards.definition: An amount of native coin given to the proposer of a new valid block.

blockchain.definition: Um sistema no qual um registro de transações de criptomoedas é mantido em vários computadores em todo o mundo.

blockchain apps.definition: Blockchain applications that allow you to swap cryptocurrency, use web3 social media, make charitable donations, or even learn onchain — like at Bankless Academy.

blockchain appss.definition: Aplicativos na blockchain que permitem trocar criptomoedas, usar redes sociais baseadas em web3, fazer doações para obras de caridade, ou até mesmo aprender na blockchain — como na Bankless Academy.

blockchain architecture.definition: The structures for how data is stored in blockchain technology.

blockchain architectures.definition: The structures for how data is stored in blockchain technology.

blockchain technologys.definition: Um novo tipo de rede, hospedada em vários computadores. Ela está adicionando uma nova camada de propriedade digital à Internet.

blockchain trilemma.definition: The problem describing the need for all 3 blockchain qualities: Security, Scalability, and Decentralization.

blockchain trilemmas.definition: The problem describing the need for all 3 blockchain qualities: Security, Scalability, and Decentralization.

blockchains.definition: Um sistema no qual um registro de transações de criptomoedas é mantido em vários computadores em todo o mundo.

blocks.definition: A group of transactions on the blockchain.

blockspace.definition: The amount of space on a blockchain that can be used to store information and run code. The amount of “space” within one (or a series of) block(s).

blockspaces.definition: The amount of space on a blockchain that can be used to store information and run code. The amount of “space” within one (or a series of) block(s).

borrower.definition: Willing to pay interest to lenders in order to borrow assets.

borrowers.definition: Willing to pay interest to lenders in order to borrow assets.

bridge.definition: Connection that allows two different blockchain networks to communicate with each other and exchange assets.

bridges.definition: Connection that allows two different blockchain networks to communicate with each other and exchange assets.

btc.definition: O símbolo de mercado do bitcoin.

btcs.definition: O símbolo de mercado do bitcoin.

carteira.definition: Uma carteira é um aplicativo ou dispositivo usado para enviar e receber ativos de criptomoedas na blockchain.

carteira custodial.definition: Com uma carteira custodial, outra entidade controla suas chaves privadas, controlando assim o acesso aos seus ativos.

carteira de auto-custódia.definition: (Também conhecida como carteira não custodial) Com uma carteira de auto-custódia, apenas você controla suas chaves privadas, as quais, por sua vez, controlam seus ativos de criptomoeda.

carteira de criptomoedas.definition: Um aplicativo que permite armazenar suas criptomoedas e enviar/receber ou gastá-las.

carteira fria.definition: Um tipo de carteira de auto-custódia que é armazenada em um hardware off-line.

carteira quente.definition: Um tipo de carteira de auto-custódia que está perpetuamente conectada à Internet.

carteiras frias.definition: Um tipo de carteira de auto-custódia que é armazenada em um hardware off-line.

carteiras quentes.definition: Um tipo de carteira de auto-custódia que está perpetuamente conectada à Internet.

censorship-resistant.definition: No government or company has control to determine what is or is not allowed.

censorship-resistants.definition: No government or company has control to determine what is or is not allowed.

centralized.definition: A single authority or entity controls the entire system.

centralized exchange.definition: (CEX) A platform that coordinates cryptocurrency trading for a fee, similar to a stock exchange.

centralized exchange staking.definition: Locking tokens through a Centralized Exchange to generate rewards.

centralized exchange stakings.definition: Locking tokens through a Centralized Exchange to generate rewards.

centralized exchanges.definition: (CEX) A platform that coordinates cryptocurrency trading for a fee, similar to a stock exchange.

centralizeds.definition: A single authority or entity controls the entire system.

cex.definition: (Centralized Exchange) A platform that coordinates cryptocurrency trading for a fee, similar to a stock exchange.

cexs.definition: (Centralized Exchange) A platform that coordinates cryptocurrency trading for a fee, similar to a stock exchange.

chain.definition: Binds blocks of data together to form a database which cannot be altered or changed.

chains.definition: Binds blocks of data together to form a database which cannot be altered or changed.

chave privada.definition: Uma chave privada concede acesso à sua carteira, permitindo que você envie ativos de criptomoedas para outras carteiras.

chave pública.definition: Uma chave pública é o endereço da sua carteira. Ela dá aos outros um ponto de referência para enviar ativos de criptomoedas para você.

circulating supplys.definition: O número de moedas ou tokens de uma criptomoeda específica disponível publicamente para o mercado negociar.

coin.definition: The native asset of a blockchain mostly used as a form of currency to facilitate transactions on the network.

coins.definition: The native asset of a blockchain mostly used as a form of currency to facilitate transactions on the network.

cold wallet.definition: A type of self-custody wallet that is stored on offline hardware.

cold wallets.definition: A type of self-custody wallet that is stored on offline hardware.

collateral.definition: A borrower's pledge of specific asset(s) to a lender, to secure repayment of a loan.

collaterals.definition: A borrower's pledge of specific asset(s) to a lender, to secure repayment of a loan.

consensus.definition: Agreement, trust, and security across a decentralized computer network like blockchains.

consensus mechanism.definition: The method by which a blockchain network judges which transactions are legitimate, and which are fraudulent.

consensus mechanisms.definition: Methods by which blockchain networks judge which transactions are legitimate, and which are fraudulent.

consensus mechanismss.definition: Methods by which blockchain networks judge which transactions are legitimate, and which are fraudulent.

consensuss.definition: Agreement, trust, and security across a decentralized computer network like blockchains.

counterparty risk.definition: The risk that another party may not fulfil its part in an agreement.

counterparty risks.definition: The risk that another party may not fulfil its part in an agreement.

credible neutrality.definition: A mechanism that does not discriminate for or against any specific people.

credible neutralitys.definition: A mechanism that does not discriminate for or against any specific people.

criptografia.definition: Técnicas para comunicações ou transações seguras, prevenindo interferência externa.

criptomoeda.definition: Uma moeda digital hospedada pela tecnologia blockchain em vez de autoridades centralizadas.

criptomoedas.definition: Uma moeda digital hospedada pela tecnologia blockchain em vez de autoridades centralizadas.

crypto wallets.definition: Um aplicativo que permite armazenar suas criptomoedas e enviar/receber ou gastá-las.

cryptocurrency minings.definition: O processo de verificação das transações na blockchain em troca de recompensas em criptomoedas.

cryptocurrency wallets.definition: Um aplicativo que permite armazenar suas criptomoedas e enviar/receber ou gastá-las.

cryptocurrencys.definition: Uma moeda digital hospedada pela tecnologia blockchain em vez de autoridades centralizadas.

cryptographys.definition: Técnicas para comunicações ou transações seguras, prevenindo interferência externa.

custodial wallet.definition: With a custodial wallet, another party controls the private keys, thus controlling access to your crypto assets.

custodial wallets.definition: Com uma carteira custodial, outra entidade controla suas chaves privadas, controlando assim o acesso aos seus ativos.

custodiante.definition: Uma instituição financeira que tem a responsabilidade de proteger seus ativos.

custodiantes.definition: Uma instituição financeira que tem a responsabilidade de proteger seus ativos.

custom record.definition: A user-defined data entry linked to an ENS domain, allowing for the storage and association of arbitrary information beyond standard blockchain addresses.

custom records.definition: A user-defined data entry linked to an ENS domain, allowing for the storage and association of arbitrary information beyond standard blockchain addresses.

dao.definition: (Decentralized Autonomous Organization) An organizational structure that uses blockchain technology to automate voting and management.

daos.definition: (Decentralized Autonomous Organization) An organizational structure that uses blockchain technology to automate voting and management.

dapp.definition: A decentralized application that connects to decentralized networks and protocols.

dapps.definition: A decentralized application that connects to decentralized networks and protocols.

decentralizations.definition: A transferência de controle para vários indivíduos em vez de uma única autoridade.

decentralized exchange.definition: (DEX) A protocol that facilitates exchange without requiring trusted intermediaries.

decentralized exchanges.definition: (DEX) A protocol that facilitates exchange without requiring trusted intermediaries.

decentralized finance.definition: (DeFi) A set of self-custody finance tools, hosted on a blockchain.

decentralized finances.definition: (DeFi) A set of self-custody finance tools, hosted on a blockchain.

decentralized moneys.definition: Moeda com propriedades acordadas pela comunidade, em vez de estabelecidas por uma instituição.

decentralizeds.definition: Nenhum órgão ou entidade única controla o sistema.

defi.definition: (Decentralized Finance) A set of self-custody finance tools, hosted on a blockchain.

defis.definition: (Decentralized Finance) A set of self-custody finance tools, hosted on a blockchain.

delegate.definition: Giving a specific responsibility to another person, i.e. delegation of token voting power.

delegates.definition: Giving a specific responsibility to another person, i.e. delegation of token voting power.

delegation.definition: Giving a specific responsibility to another person, i.e. delegation of token voting power.

delegations.definition: Giving a specific responsibility to another person, i.e. delegation of token voting power.

democracy.definition: A system of government where citizens exercise power by playing a key role in decision-making.

democracys.definition: A system of government where citizens exercise power by playing a key role in decision-making.

descentralizado.definition: Nenhum órgão ou entidade única controla o sistema.

descentralização.definition: A transferência de controle para vários indivíduos em vez de uma única autoridade.

dex.definition: Decentralized Exchange: A protocol that facilitates exchange without requiring trusted intermediaries.

dex aggregator.definition: Protocol that combines DEX liquidity from multiple sources in one interface.

dex aggregators.definition: Protocol that combines DEX liquidity from multiple sources in one interface.

dexs.definition: Decentralized Exchange: A protocol that facilitates exchange without requiring trusted intermediaries.

digital signature.definition: The unique identifier for each user that serves the function of personal stamps or physical signatures in the digital space.

digital signatures.definition: The unique identifier for each user that serves the function of personal stamps or physical signatures in the digital space.

dinheiro descentralizado.definition: Moeda com propriedades acordadas pela comunidade, em vez de estabelecidas por uma instituição.

earn.definition: Contributing value in exchange for rewards ; money verb on the skill cube.

earns.definition: Contributing value in exchange for rewards ; money verb on the skill cube.

encriptação.definition: O processo de conversão de informações em código privado e seguro, usado para impedir o acesso não autorizado.

encryptions.definition: O processo de conversão de informações em código privado e seguro, usado para impedir o acesso não autorizado.

epoch.definition: The time taken for a specific number of blocks to be included on any particular blockchain.

epochs.definition: The time taken for a specific number of blocks to be included on any particular blockchain.

equality of opportunitys.definition: Um princípio de equidade, onde todos têm as mesmas chances de sucesso independentemente de sua origem ou circunstâncias.

erc-1155.definition: A standard for deploying both fungible and non-fungible tokens on Ethereum, under one optimized contract.

erc-1155s.definition: A standard for deploying both fungible and non-fungible tokens on Ethereum, under one optimized contract.

erc-20.definition: A standard for fungible tokens on Ethereum. These tokens are divisible and non-unique.

erc-20s.definition: A standard for fungible tokens on Ethereum. These tokens are divisible and non-unique.

erc-721.definition: A standard for non-fungible tokens on Ethereum. These tokens have a unique digital identifier, cannot be copied, or subdivided.

erc-721s.definition: A standard for non-fungible tokens on Ethereum. These tokens have a unique digital identifier, cannot be copied, or subdivided.

escasso.definition: Estar com pouco suprimento ou baixa quantidade disponível.

eth.definition: (Ether) Ethereum’s native coin. Used in staking and performing transactions on the network.

ether.definition: (ETH) Ethereum’s native coin. Used in staking and performing transactions on the network.

ethereum virtual machine.definition: The Ethereum Virtual Machine or EVM is a piece of software that executes smart contracts and computes the state of the Ethereum network.

ethereum virtual machines.definition: The Ethereum Virtual Machine or EVM is a piece of software that executes smart contracts and computes the state of the Ethereum network.

ethers.definition: (ETH) Ethereum’s native coin. Used in staking and performing transactions on the network.

eths.definition: (Ether) Ethereum’s native coin. Used in staking and performing transactions on the network.

fomo.definition: (Fear Of Missing Out) Anxiety or apprehension about not being included in something.

fomos.definition: (Fear Of Missing Out) Anxiety or apprehension about not being included in something.

fork.definition: Refers to a radical change in a blockchain network that results in two branches — one following the previous protocol, and the other following a new one.

forks.definition: Refers to a radical change in a blockchain network that results in two branches — one following the previous protocol, and the other following a new one.

frase de recuperação.definition: Uma frase de recuperação é uma lista de 12 a 24 palavras, usada para gerar a chave pública e a chave privada de sua carteira.

fraud.definition: In blockchain economies: Unfair or fake transactions, used to change amounts of cryptocurrency held.

fraud proof.definition: Evidence that a transaction is invalid and that fraud has occurred.

fraud proofs.definition: Evidence that a transaction is invalid and that fraud has occurred.

frauds.definition: In blockchain economies: Unfair or fake transactions, used to change amounts of cryptocurrency held.

gasless transactions.definition: A transaction that pays gas using some of the token to be traded rather than the native coin of the blockchain network.

gasless transactionss.definition: A transaction that pays gas using some of the token to be traded rather than the native coin of the blockchain network.

gold standards.definition: Um sistema monetário em que a moeda de um país tem um valor diretamente vinculado ao ouro.

gwei.definition: A unit used on Ethereum blockchain, equivalent to 0.000000001 ETH (one billionth), used commonly to describe gas prices.

gweis.definition: A unit used on Ethereum blockchain, equivalent to 0.000000001 ETH (one billionth), used commonly to describe gas prices.

hardware wallet.definition: A type of self-custody wallet that stores private keys offline in a physical hardware device.

hardware wallets.definition: A type of self-custody wallet that stores private keys offline in a physical hardware device.

hashing function.definition: A function that is easy to calculate in one direction only, making it nearly impossible to reverse engineer the inputs and functionally guaranteeing unique outputs for a given input.

hashing functions.definition: A function that is easy to calculate in one direction only, making it nearly impossible to reverse engineer the inputs and functionally guaranteeing unique outputs for a given input.

hodl.definition: (Hold On for Dear Life) Crypto slang for not selling crypto no matter what the market conditions are.

hodls.definition: (Hold On for Dear Life) Crypto slang for not selling crypto no matter what the market conditions are.

hot wallet.definition: A type of self-custody wallet that is perpetually connected to the internet.

hot wallets.definition: A type of self-custody wallet that is perpetually connected to the internet.

igualdade de oportunidades.definition: Um princípio de equidade, onde todos têm as mesmas chances de sucesso independentemente de sua origem ou circunstâncias.

inflation.definition: A general increase in prices and fall in the purchasing power of money.

inflations.definition: A general increase in prices and fall in the purchasing power of money.

intermediary token.definition: A token that is part of the middle of a trade route, not the starting or ending token.

intermediary tokens.definition: A token that is part of the middle of a trade route, not the starting or ending token.

invest.definition: The act of buying a coin/token that uses DeFi technology.

invests.definition: The act of buying a coin/token that uses DeFi technology.

l1.definition: Layer 1 refers to a base network such as Bitcoin or Ethereum.

l1s.definition: Layer 1 refers to a base network such as Bitcoin or Ethereum.

l2.definition: A blockchain that extends Ethereum scalability while inheriting Ethereum security.

l2s.definition: A blockchain that extends Ethereum scalability while inheriting Ethereum security.

layer 1.definition: Layer 1 refers to a base network such as Bitcoin or Ethereum.

layer 1s.definition: Layer 1 refers to a base network such as Bitcoin or Ethereum.

layer 2.definition: A blockchain that extends Ethereum scalability while inheriting Ethereum security.

layer 2s.definition: A blockchain that extends Ethereum scalability while inheriting Ethereum security.

ledger.definition: The record of all transactions that have ever occurred.

ledgers.definition: The record of all transactions that have ever occurred.

liquid.definition: In blockchain economies: The ability to easily use a digital asset in trading, or use in smart contracts.

liquid staking token.definition: Tokens representing staked Ether. Holders earn a portion of staking rewards proportial to the amounts staked.

liquid staking tokens.definition: Tokens representing staked Ether. Holders earn a portion of staking rewards proportial to the amounts staked.

liquidity.definition: The quantity of a token available for trading.

liquidity pool.definition: A communal vault of tokens that facilitates permissionless token swaps.

liquidity pools.definition: A communal vault of tokens that facilitates permissionless token swaps.

liquiditys.definition: The quantity of a token available for trading.

liquids.definition: In blockchain economies: The ability to easily use a digital asset in trading, or use in smart contracts.

lp.definition: (Liquidity Provider) Blockchain users who loan their tokens to protocols in exchange for a share in fees.

lps.definition: (Liquidity Provider) Blockchain users who loan their tokens to protocols in exchange for a share in fees.

lsts.definition: Tokens representing staked Ether. Holders earn a portion of staking rewards proportial to the amounts staked.

lstss.definition: Tokens representing staked Ether. Holders earn a portion of staking rewards proportial to the amounts staked.

market cap.definition: The total value of a given token, or market sector.

market caps.definition: The total value of a given token, or market sector.

max supplys.definition: O número máximo de moedas ou tokens que existirão para uma determinada criptomoeda.

memecoin.definition: A cryptocurrency token themed on an internet meme, often with no purpose or utility.

memecoins.definition: A cryptocurrency token themed on an internet meme, often with no purpose or utility.

meta-aggregator.definition: A tool that brings together other aggregators into an extra overview layer.

meta-aggregators.definition: A tool that brings together other aggregators into an extra overview layer.

mev.definition: Maximal extractible value - value extracted by ordering transactions within blocks.

mevs.definition: Maximal extractible value - value extracted by ordering transactions within blocks.

minerador.definition: Um indivíduo que participa na validação de transações de criptomoedas e na proposta de blocos.

mineradores.definition: Um indivíduo que participa na validação de transações de criptomoedas e na proposta de blocos.

mineração de criptomoedas.definition: O processo de verificação das transações na blockchain em troca de recompensas em criptomoedas.

mining.definition: The process by which transactions are verified and added as blocks to the blockchain.

minings.definition: The process by which transactions are verified and added as blocks to the blockchain.

mint.definition: Issuing new fungible or non-fungible cryptocurrency tokens on a given blockchain.

mints.definition: Issuing new fungible or non-fungible cryptocurrency tokens on a given blockchain.

monetary policys.definition: Como um banco central administra a quantidade de dinheiro que circula em uma economia.

money.definition: A medium of exchange, a unit of account, and a store of value, used to facilitate transactions for goods and services.

moneys.definition: A medium of exchange, a unit of account, and a store of value, used to facilitate transactions for goods and services.

network governance.definition: The process by which a decentralized community reaches agreement on network features/upgrades.

network governances.definition: The process by which a decentralized community reaches agreement on network features/upgrades.

neutrality.definition: The principle of treating all participants equally, without bias towards any user or group.

neutralitys.definition: The principle of treating all participants equally, without bias towards any user or group.

nft.definition: (Non-fungible Token) A token with a unique ID that cannot be replicated, as compared to a fungible token like Ether that has no unique identifier.

nfts.definition: (Non-fungible Token) A token with a unique ID that cannot be replicated, as compared to a fungible token like Ether that has no unique identifier.

node operator.definition: A member of the Ethereum community, running a validator node to process transactions on the network.

node operators.definition: A member of the Ethereum community, running a validator node to process transactions on the network.

onchain governance.definition: The automated system that mediates changes to a blockchain’s structure.

onchain governances.definition: The automated system that mediates changes to a blockchain’s structure.

open source.definition: Software with source code that anyone can inspect, modify, and enhance.

open sources.definition: Software with source code that anyone can inspect, modify, and enhance.

optimistic rollup.definition: A layer 2 rollup scaling solution that optimistically assumes all transactions in its “rolled up” transaction are valid until they are proven false by a fraud proof.

optimistic rollups.definition: A layer 2 rollup scaling solution that optimistically assumes all transactions in its “rolled up” transaction are valid until they are proven false by a fraud proof.

otc.definition: (Over the Counter) Trades made directly with private entities.

otcs.definition: (Over the Counter) Trades made directly with private entities.

over the counter.definition: (OTC) Trades made directly with private entities.

over the counters.definition: (OTC) Trades made directly with private entities.

padrão ouro.definition: Um sistema monetário em que a moeda de um país tem um valor diretamente vinculado ao ouro.

payment channel.definition: Allows two parties to transact multiple times without the need for each transaction to be recorded on the blockchain.

payment channels.definition: Allows two parties to transact multiple times without the need for each transaction to be recorded on the blockchain.

peer-to-peer.definition: Uma transação entre duas partes que não requer um intermediário ou entidade controladora.

peer-to-peers.definition: Uma transação entre duas partes que não requer um intermediário ou entidade controladora.

peg.definition: Method of maintaining value equivalence between two or more assets.

pegs.definition: Method of maintaining value equivalence between two or more assets.

permissionless.definition: Not requiring the permission of any entity.

permissionlesss.definition: Not requiring the permission of any entity.

phishing.definition: A type of social engineering attack where the attacker poses as a trusted person or organization to trick victims into sharing sensitive information or sending them money.

phishings.definition: A type of social engineering attack where the attacker poses as a trusted person or organization to trick victims into sharing sensitive information or sending them money.

poap.definition: A POAP (Proof of Attendance Protocol) is a badge that keeps a reliable record of life experiences in your wallet, like for example successfully completing a lesson.

poaps.definition: A POAP (Proof of Attendance Protocol) is a badge that keeps a reliable record of life experiences in your wallet, like for example successfully completing a lesson.

política monetária.definition: Como um banco central administra a quantidade de dinheiro que circula em uma economia.

price impact.definition: The amount prices on a DEX change due to the trade size.

price impacts.definition: The amount prices on a DEX change due to the trade size.

private key.definition: A private key grants access to your wallet, allowing you to send crypto assets to other wallets.

private keys.definition: Uma chave privada concede acesso à sua carteira, permitindo que você envie ativos de criptomoedas para outras carteiras.

proof of stake.definition: Blockchain Consensus algorithms that randomly choose a block producer based on a stake each entity has locked into the protocol.

proof of stakes.definition: Blockchain Consensus algorithms that randomly choose a block producer based on a stake each entity has locked into the protocol.

proof of work.definition: Blockchain Consensus algorithms that rely on “work” done by miners competing to create valid blocks by proposing blocks and seeing if each one has a valid hash.

proof of works.definition: Blockchain Consensus algorithms that rely on “work” done by miners competing to create valid blocks by proposing blocks and seeing if each one has a valid hash.

proof-of-stake.definition: A blockchain consensus method that selects validator nodes based on the amount of stake locked by the node.

proof-of-stakes.definition: A blockchain consensus method that selects validator nodes based on the amount of stake locked by the node.

public.definition: Public blockchains allow anyone to view the blockchain ledger.

public good.definition: A public good is a commodity or service that is available to all members of society.

public goods.definition: A public good is a commodity or service that is available to all members of society.

public key.definition: A public key is your wallet’s address. It gives others a point of reference to send crypto assets to you.

public keys.definition: Uma chave pública é o endereço da sua carteira. Ela dá aos outros um ponto de referência para enviar ativos de criptomoedas para você.

publics.definition: Public blockchains allow anyone to view the blockchain ledger.

recovery phrase.definition: A recovery phrase is a list of 12 to 24 words, used to generate your wallet's public key and private key.

recovery phrases.definition: Uma frase de recuperação é uma lista de 12 a 24 palavras, usada para gerar a chave pública e a chave privada de sua carteira.

restaking.definition: Reusing staked Ether tokens to help secure and validate other protocols, in exchange for rewards.

restakings.definition: Reusing staked Ether tokens to help secure and validate other protocols, in exchange for rewards.

retropgf.definition: (Retroactive Public Goods Funding) A mechanism for funding projects, based on their historical impact.

retropgfs.definition: (Retroactive Public Goods Funding) A mechanism for funding projects, based on their historical impact.

rollup.definition: A layer-2 scaling solution that allows for processing a high number of off-chain transactions and aggregating them in a single, larger on-chain transaction, increasing transaction throughput and lowering costs.

rollups.definition: A layer-2 scaling solution that allows for processing a high number of off-chain transactions and aggregating them in a single, larger on-chain transaction, increasing transaction throughput and lowering costs.

sandwich attack.definition: A hidden cost for users due to ordering of transactions by block producers.

sandwich attacks.definition: A hidden cost for users due to ordering of transactions by block producers.

satoshi nakamoto.definition: O pseudônimo do criador do Bitcoin. Até hoje, ninguém conhece sua verdadeira identidade.

satoshi nakamotos.definition: O pseudônimo do criador do Bitcoin. Até hoje, ninguém conhece sua verdadeira identidade.

scalability.definition: A blockchain’s capability to handle a growing amount of work, transactions, and usage with minimal disruption for users.

scalabilitys.definition: A blockchain’s capability to handle a growing amount of work, transactions, and usage with minimal disruption for users.

scam-token.definition: A cryptocurrency token that is launched for the sole purpose of stealing investor funds.

scam-tokens.definition: A cryptocurrency token that is launched for the sole purpose of stealing investor funds.

scarces.definition: Estar com pouco suprimento ou baixa quantidade disponível.

security.definition: Ability of a blockchain to withstand hacking attempts, code exploits, and economic exploits among other attacks, and continue to function as normal.

securitys.definition: Ability of a blockchain to withstand hacking attempts, code exploits, and economic exploits among other attacks, and continue to function as normal.

seed phrase.definition: Group of random words generated by a wallet on setup, they act as the master key to ALL accounts controlled by that wallet. NEVER SHARE YOUR SEED PHRASE WITH ANYONE FOR ANY REASON.

seed phrases.definition: Group of random words generated by a wallet on setup, they act as the master key to ALL accounts controlled by that wallet. NEVER SHARE YOUR SEED PHRASE WITH ANYONE FOR ANY REASON.

self-custodials.definition: Um método de armazenamento de seus ativos no qual apenas você tem acesso a eles.

self-custody wallet.definition: (AKA: Non-custodial wallet) With a self-custody wallet, you have sole control of your private keys, which in turn control your crypto assets.

self-custody wallets.definition: (Também conhecida como carteira não custodial) Com uma carteira de auto-custódia, apenas você controla suas chaves privadas, as quais, por sua vez, controlam seus ativos de criptomoeda.

self-custodys.definition: Um método de armazenamento de seus ativos no qual apenas você tem acesso a eles.

settlement layer.definition: The “lowest” level of a blockchain that records the details of asset exchange from finalized transactions. Mainnet Ethereum is the settlement layer for Ethereum layer 2 scaling solutions.

settlement layers.definition: The “lowest” level of a blockchain that records the details of asset exchange from finalized transactions. Mainnet Ethereum is the settlement layer for Ethereum layer 2 scaling solutions.

settlement time.definition: The time need for a transaction to be confirmed.

settlement times.definition: The time need for a transaction to be confirmed.

sharding.definition: The process of splitting a single blockchain into multiple chains that all run together in parallel to increase scalability.

shardings.definition: The process of splitting a single blockchain into multiple chains that all run together in parallel to increase scalability.

sidechain.definition: A mechanism that allows for the transfer of assets and transactions from a main blockchain to a separate, parallel blockchain (sidechain).

sidechains.definition: A mechanism that allows for the transfer of assets and transactions from a main blockchain to a separate, parallel blockchain (sidechain).

slashed.definition: A penalty applied to validator nodes for publishing fraudulent transactions on Proof-of-Stake blockchains.

slasheds.definition: A penalty applied to validator nodes for publishing fraudulent transactions on Proof-of-Stake blockchains.

slippage.definition: A change in buy price that helps your trade to execute.

slippage tolerance.definition: How much can prices change before your trade executes.

slippage tolerances.definition: How much can prices change before your trade executes.

slippages.definition: A change in buy price that helps your trade to execute.

smart contract.definition: Computerized code that execute terms of a contract automatically.

smart contracts.definition: Computerized code that execute terms of a contract automatically.

social engineering.definition: Manipulating someone into sharing sensitive or confidential information such as passwords or seed phrases.

social engineerings.definition: Manipulating someone into sharing sensitive or confidential information such as passwords or seed phrases.

solo staker.definition: A node operator running an independent validator node.

solo stakers.definition: A node operator running an independent validator node.

solo staking.definition: Directly running a validator node, granting the ability to directly process transactions in Proof-Of-Stake systems.

solo stakings.definition: Directly running a validator node, granting the ability to directly process transactions in Proof-Of-Stake systems.

spend.definition: Using your crypto assets to pay for goods or services.

spends.definition: Using your crypto assets to pay for goods or services.

stake.definition: The amount of a financial asset locked into a cryptocurrency protocol. It represents someone’s financial commitment to the protocol, their “skin in the game”.

staker.definition: A member of the Ethereum community, providing Ether to a validator node, in exchange for rewards.

stakers.definition: Members of the Ethereum community, providing Ether to validator nodes, in exchange for rewards.

stakerss.definition: Members of the Ethereum community, providing Ether to validator nodes, in exchange for rewards.

stakes.definition: The amount of a financial asset locked into a cryptocurrency protocol. It represents someone’s financial commitment to the protocol, their “skin in the game”.

staking.definition: The temporary commitment of a portion of your crypto into a smart contract for a specified amount of time in exchange for earning interest ("rewards").

staking pool.definition: On Ethereum: Smart contracts through which stakers provide Ether to another staker’s validator node.

staking pools.definition: On Ethereum: Smart contracts through which stakers provide Ether to another staker’s validator node.

staking providers.definition: A digital platform providing staking services, usually through staking pools.

staking providerss.definition: A digital platform providing staking services, usually through staking pools.

stakings.definition: The temporary commitment of a portion of your crypto into a smart contract for a specified amount of time in exchange for earning interest ("rewards").

suprimento circulante.definition: O número de moedas ou tokens de uma criptomoeda específica disponível publicamente para o mercado negociar.

suprimento máximo.definition: O número máximo de moedas ou tokens que existirão para uma determinada criptomoeda.

swap.definition: A trade from one token to another.

swaps.definition: A trade from one token to another.

tecnologia blockchain.definition: Um novo tipo de rede, hospedada em vários computadores. Ela está adicionando uma nova camada de propriedade digital à Internet.

token.definition: Units that can stand for assets or deeds that are built on an existing blockchain.

token allowance.definition: An agreement between a wallet and smart contract, allowing limited or unlimited access to a specific token.

token allowances.definition: An agreement between a wallet and smart contract, allowing limited or unlimited access to a specific token.

token distribution.definition: The way in which tokens are allocated across different stakeholder groups.

token distributions.definition: The way in which tokens are allocated across different stakeholder groups.

token pair.definition: The two associated cryptocurrencies that make up a liquidity pool.

token pairs.definition: The two associated cryptocurrencies that make up a liquidity pool.

tokens.definition: Units that can stand for assets or deeds that are built on an existing blockchain.

tps.definition: A measure of a blockchains scalability, TPS is the number of transactions per second processed by a blockchain.

tpss.definition: A measure of a blockchains scalability, TPS is the number of transactions per second processed by a blockchain.

trade.definition: Exchanging assets or money for something valuable ; money verb on the skill cube.

trade route.definition: What is the path taken from starting token to ending token in a trade.

trade routes.definition: What is the path taken from starting token to ending token in a trade.

trade routing.definition: Planning the path taken from starting token to ending token in a trade.

trade routings.definition: Planning the path taken from starting token to ending token in a trade.

trades.definition: Exchanging assets or money for something valuable ; money verb on the skill cube.

transaction.definition: A record of transfer, monetary or otherwise, on the blockchain.

transaction finality.definition: The time it takes to be sure that a transaction is valid and final, meaning it won't be reversed or changed.

transaction finalitys.definition: The time it takes to be sure that a transaction is valid and final, meaning it won't be reversed or changed.

transaction hash.definition: The unique identifier for each transaction; it is derived from the transaction data, the digital signature of the transaction sender, and a one-time use number to avoid duplicate transactions.

transaction hashs.definition: The unique identifier for each transaction; it is derived from the transaction data, the digital signature of the transaction sender, and a one-time use number to avoid duplicate transactions.

transaction throughput.definition: How many transactions a blockchain can process at once, usually measured in transactions per second (TPS).

transaction throughputs.definition: How many transactions a blockchain can process at once, usually measured in transactions per second (TPS).

transactions.definition: A record of transfer, monetary or otherwise, on the blockchain.

trustless.definition: The quality of operating without need to trust in people or institutions. (Automatic, not owned by any one person).

trustlesss.definition: The quality of operating without need to trust in people or institutions. (Automatic, not owned by any one person).

tvl.definition: (Total Value Locked) The overall amount of asset value stored in a specific place.

tvls.definition: (Total Value Locked) The overall amount of asset value stored in a specific place.

validating bridge.definition: A validating bridge contract is a new design that removes the need to trust any external authority to decide if a withdrawal is valid.

validating bridges.definition: A validating bridge contract is a new design that removes the need to trust any external authority to decide if a withdrawal is valid.

validator node.definition: A computer device run by a member of the Ethereum community. As the original method of staking, it processes transactions on the network.

validator nodes.definition: Computer devices run by members of the Ethereum community. As the original method of staking, they process transactions on the network.

validator nodess.definition: Computer devices run by members of the Ethereum community. As the original method of staking, they process transactions on the network.

veto.definition: A vote in rejection of a governance proposal.

vetos.definition: A vote in rejection of a governance proposal.

wallet.definition: A wallet is an application or device used to send and receive crypto assets on the blockchain.

wallet app.definition: An app on your computer or phone, used to connect to your wallet on the blockchain.

wallet apps.definition: Um aplicativo em seu computador ou celular, usado para se conectar à sua carteira na blockchain.

wallet provider.definition: The creator of the software you use to access your wallet. These providers do not own your wallet, but instead act as a bridge that lets you access your account on the blockchain.

wallet providers.definition: The creator of the software you use to access your wallet. These providers do not own your wallet, but instead act as a bridge that lets you access your account on the blockchain.

wallets.definition: Uma carteira é um aplicativo ou dispositivo usado para enviar e receber ativos de criptomoedas na blockchain.

web2.definition: O estado atual da internet, sem a infraestrutura blockchain.

web2s.definition: O estado atual da internet, sem a infraestrutura blockchain.

web3.definition: Refere-se à internet de blockchains, onde os usuários podem auto-custodiar seus ativos e dados.

web3s.definition: Refere-se à internet de blockchains, onde os usuários podem auto-custodiar seus ativos e dados.

zero-knowledge.definition: Mathematical method that allows one party to prove a statement is valid without revealing any additional information about it.

zero-knowledges.definition: Mathematical method that allows one party to prove a statement is valid without revealing any additional information about it.

zk rollup.definition: A layer-2 rollup scaling solution that uses zero-knowledge proofs to guarantee the validity of “rolled up” transactions while maintaining security and privacy on the layer 1 blockchain.

zk rollups.definition: A layer-2 rollup scaling solution that uses zero-knowledge proofs to guarantee the validity of “rolled up” transactions while maintaining security and privacy on the layer 1 blockchain.
